metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14625 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux Kernel where an attacker may be able to havean uncontrolled read to kernel-memory from within a vm guest. A racecondition between connect() and close() function may allow an attackerusing the AF_VSOCK protocol to gather a 4 byte information leak or possiblyintercept or corrupt AF_VSOCK messages destined to other clients.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14625` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-lowlatency - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-snapdragon - 5.4.0-9.12
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1004-raspi2 - 5.4.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1005-aws - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1006-azure - 5.4.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1005-gcp - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1004-kvm - 5.4.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1005-oracle - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.6.0-1007-oem - 5.6.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1007-raspi - 5.4.0-1007.7
No subscription required
